text: Émile Grémaux (1893 – 18 September 1959, in Lille) – boxer, coach and businessman. Long serving President of the French Boxing Federation. First President of International Amateur Boxing Association (AIBA) (1946–1959).AIBA History Vice-President of the Olympic French Committee (1952–1959). E. Grémaux was the Champion of the Northern France in the weight of feather-cock in 1914. He died at Lille, France, where he lived, at the age of 66, after a long illness. ==References== Category:1893 births Category:1959 deaths Category:French male boxers Category:Lightweight boxers Category:French referees and umpires Category:Boxing people
title: Émile Grémaux
